item.title: The Princeton Companion to Mathematics
item.description: Part I Introduction: What Is Mathematics About? The Language and Grammar of Mathematics Some Fundamental Mathematical Definitions The General Goals of Mathematical Research Part II The Origins of Modern Mathematics: From Numbers to Number Systems Geometry The Development of Abstract Algebra Algorithms The Development of Rigor in Mathematical Analysis The Development of the Idea of Proof The Crisis in the Foundations of Mathematics Part III Mathematical Concepts:
